conflictDescription: User Story A wants caregivers to join virtual exercise sessions with clients, implying meetings should be open for them. User Story B requires all developer meetings to be online without exceptions, implying control over meeting access, which may forbid open joining by caregivers. These opposite expectations on meeting access create a conflict.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to join exercise sessions with my clients to support them and strengthen our connection.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to hold all meetings online without exceptions, so I can explain updates and keep control.
